publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1475 Mr John McAllion: Victorian Dundee-That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Victorian Dundee: Image and Realities edited by Louise Miskell, Christopher A. Whatley and Bob Harris; recognises that this book makes a major contribution to our understanding of the history of Dundee, telling the story of the city at a time when contemporaries were struck by its energy, optimism and commitment to social provision, and notes the excellent work of the Department of History in the University of Dundee in the fields of Scottish, British and International History.

S1M-1475 Mr John McAllion: Victorian Dundee-That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Victorian Dundee: Image and Realities edited by Louise Miskell, Christopher A. Whatley and Bob Harris; recognises that this book makes a major contribution to our understanding of the history of Dundee, telling the story of the city at a time when contemporaries were struck by its energy, optimism and commitment to social provision, and notes the excellent work of the Department of History in the University of Dundee in the fields of Scottish, British and International History.
S1M-1475 Victorian Dundee (lodged on 14 December 2000) Tommy Sheridan*
S1M-1475 Victorian Dundee (lodged on 14 December 2000) Alex Neil*, Mr Kenneth Gibson*
S1M-1475 Victorian Dundee (lodged on 14 December 2000) Scott Barrie*, Pauline McNeill*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1475 Mr John McAllion: Victorian Dundee—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of Victorian Dundee: Image and Realities edited by Louise Miskell, Christopher A. Whatley and Bob Harris; recognises that this book makes a major contribution to our understanding of the history of Dundee, telling the story of the city at a time when contemporaries were struck by its energy, optimism and commitment to social provision, and notes the excellent work of the Department of History in the University of Dundee in the fields of Scottish, British and International History. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan, Alex Neil, Mr Kenneth Gibson, Scott Barrie, Pauline McNeill, Maureen Macmillan, Mr Jamie Stone, Mary Scanlon

S1M-1475 Victorian Dundee (lodged on 14 December 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Andrew Wilson*
